pros: Benefits are excellent, Great location Great community.
cons: Higher education is a difficult market to be in right now but Moravian is doing well.

pros: Some of the finest Coworkers I've ever worked with.
cons: The Chief of Police has created the most toxic work environment that I have ever encountered. Micromanagement is the law of the land. Nearly every department employee has been called on the carpet to answer for non-existent transgressions in order for them to become unemployable elsewhere. He does this so that people stop quitting. One of my favorite sayings of his, to paraphrase: we have too many old white people here...

pros: The staff is rather small compared to larger admissions' offices, though this fosters a sense of community. Many of the people that work here are graduates of the university. There's a solid work-life balance.
cons: The pay is pretty low, especially for the amount of work required during travel seasons. There isn't much room for growth, or raises, even if you deliver performance wise. Lots of turnover.

review_title: Friendly, safe, low pay, little growth
pros: Friendly, safe, flexible with time off
cons: low pay, little growth, big budget for everything else but little for employees compensation/growth

review_title: Nice people, low salaries, little growth opportunities
pros: Nice people, friendly atmosphere, fun events
cons: low salaries, little growth opportunities

pros: Excellent researchers to work with.
cons: Not able to extend to year-round.

pros: Students are great! Location is nice.
cons: A lot of responsibility with little pay. Parking is terrible.

pros: Boss is nice and very flexible
cons: There are no cons to this job

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Bethlehem, PA
pros: Nice place and quality like to be there every time I could
cons: I'm not sure what is pros and cons but this is my opinion about Moravian, in general, is the best thing that happened to my life. Just awesome!

review_title: Low compensation for high level of work, trade off for community feel
pros: Community feel of small school, retirement plan
cons: Salary was low comparable to other companies and often had to work overtime, difficult to take vacation

pros: Steady workflow that can be modified to an academic environment.
cons: The pay is not very high.

pros: the other employees are nice and the lunch room offers free food also the supervisors are helpful.
cons: I asked if they had my schedule they said they had it done. They said they had to redo it do to someone getting sick in the lunch room. They said they would call me and I never got a call. I got up and went to work the next day for no reason.

pros: People care about each other
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: A sad and difficult character building experience.
job_title: Assistant Director of Plant Operations in Bethlehem, PA
pros: Many of faculty and staff are caring and good people.  The benefits are great and tuition reimbursement is available for employees and their family.
cons: The school is really struggling in terms of enrollment and funding.  There is a new, young president who has new ideas and the entrenched leadership is not sure how to react.  The facilities department is a mess with too few staff, upper management who is not sure what they are looking for (and unable to communicate this to lower level employees) and overall low moral.  People don't seem to like each other.

pros: You are able to work at your own pace, while keeping up with the ladies everyone can take break together and the higher- ups listen to you and what you are saying.
cons: One of the cons was starting at 4AM, which isn't always easy for some. Especially if they live 30-45 minutes away from work and don't have a great car, and are a single woman.

review_title: I was a student worker for the college
pros: They worked my hours around my schedule and activities. It gave me some work experience without taking me away from my studies.
cons: The pay was low but that is to be expected when being a student worker. Sometimes the work i was doing felt necessary.

review_title: I loved my job at Moravian College
job_title: User Support Analyst in Bethlehem, PA
pros: It was a community, with good benefits/vacation time.
cons: the only challenge was not many raises from 2010 on because of the economy.

review_title: A great place to work and learn!
pros: Moravian College is a great place to work!  This is a very friendly, supportive work environment.  The people genuinely care about each other and the students.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Great place to work with dedicated staff & faculty
pros: Simply a great place to work
cons: There are really no negatives

pros: Gain experience in the field
cons: Low wages, limited opportunity for growth

pros: Casework was always overwhelming and unfinished
cons: Pay was substantially better than most jobs
